snippet: A celebrated defector is no longer optimistic that the United States has the will to stop the abuses committed by the Assad government.
abstract: Former Syrian police photographer known as Caesar, who smuggled photos documenting deaths of thousands of prisoners out of country, has become less optimistic that United States will take action against regime of Pres Bashar al-Assad; his concerns reflect broader discontent within moderate Syrian opposition that poses new challenge for Obama administration’s strategy to counter Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: A celebrated defector is no longer optimistic that the United States has the will to stop the abuses committed by the Assad government.

headline.main: Syrian’s Photos Spur Outrage, but Not Action
headline.print_headline: Syrian’s Photos Spur Outrage, but Not Action

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
